edu.cnm.deepdive.android

Class FragmentService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.android.FragmentService

  • public class FragmentService
extends Object
    Provides app-wide fragment management services, intended primarily for use in apps without extensive back stack requirements, where some navigation view (e.g. a navigation drawer, or a bottom navigation view), available app-wide, is used to move between the primary UI fragments, and where those fragments should not be re-instantiated every time the user navigates between them.

    The singleton pattern is implemented by this class, exposing its capabilities via a single instance returned by the getInstance() method.

    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett, Deep Dive Coding

      • getInstance

        public static FragmentService getInstance()
        Returns the single instance of FragmentService.
        Returns:

      • getLoadFragmentTransaction

        public androidx.fragment.app.FragmentTransaction getLoadFragmentTransaction(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                                                            int containerId,
                                                                            androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                                                                            String tag)
        Attaches the specified fragment to the specified activity and container, with a specified tag, in an initially visible state, and returns the not-yet-committed transaction.
        Parameters:
        activity - host of fragment.
        containerId - id of ViewGroup to which the fragment will be attached.
        fragment - fragment to be loaded.
        tag - String identifier of fragment.
        Returns:
        uncommitted transaction.

      • loadFragment

        public void loadFragment(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                         int containerId,
                         androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                         String tag,
                         boolean visible)
        Attaches the specified fragment to the specified activity and container, with a specified tag, in an initially visible or hidden state. Note that while showFragment(FragmentActivity, int, Fragment) ensures that only one fragment attached to a single container (at most) is visible at a time, this method performs no such checks.
        Parameters:
        activity - host of fragment.
        containerId - id of ViewGroup to which the fragment will be attached.
        fragment - fragment to be loaded.
        tag - String identifier of fragment.
        visible - initial visible state of activity.

      • getShowFragmentTransaction

        public androidx.fragment.app.FragmentTransaction getShowFragmentTransaction(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                                                            int containerId,
                                                                            androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment)
        Begins, but does not commit, a transaction to make the specified fragment visible, if it is attached to the specified activity and container. Any other fragments attached to the specified activity and container are set to be hidden in the transaction.
        Parameters:
        activity - host activity.
        containerId - host container.
        fragment - fragment to show.
        Returns:
        uncommitted transaction.

      • getShowFragmentTransaction

        public androidx.fragment.app.FragmentTransaction getShowFragmentTransaction(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                                                            int containerId,
                                                                            String tag)
        Begins, but does not commit, a transaction to make the specified fragment visible, if it is attached to the specified activity and container. Any other fragments attached to the specified activity and container are set to be hidden in the transaction.
        Parameters:
        activity - host activity.
        containerId - host container.
        tag - String identifier of fragment to show.
        Returns:
        uncommitted transaction.

      • showFragment

        public void showFragment(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                         int containerId,
                         androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment)
        Makes the specified fragment visible, if it is attached to the specified activity and container. Any other fragments attached to the specified activity and container are hidden. In any event, no visibility changes will be made to fragments not attached to both the specified host activity and container.
        Parameters:
        activity - host activity.
        containerId - host container.
        fragment - fragment to show.

      • showFragment

        public void showFragment(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                         int containerId,
                         String tag)
        Makes the specified fragment visible, if it is attached to the specified activity and container. Any other fragments attached to the specified activity and container are hidden. In any event, no visibility changes will be made to fragments not attached to both the specified host activity and container.
        Parameters:
        activity - host activity.
        containerId - host container.
        tag - String identifier of fragment to show.

      • findFragment

        public androidx.fragment.app.Fragment findFragment(androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                                   int containerId,
                                                   String tag)
        Returns a reference to a fragment with the specified tag, if it is attached to the specified activity and container. If a fragment meeting those criteria is not found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        activity - host activity.
        containerId - host container.
        tag - String identifier of fragment.
        Returns:
        fragment (null if not found).
